business.headline: Reduced US tariffs of 18% on India come into effect. What it meansThe agreement will reduce US reciprocal duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent, while scrapping tariffs entirely on items such as generic medicines, gems and diamonds, and aircraft components—opening up stronger export prospects across several key sectors.

India-US trade deal to boost exports, safeguard farmers' interests: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the India-US interim trade framework is a historic step toward achieving USD 500 billion in bilateral trade. He announced that reciprocal tariffs on Indian exports to the US will fall sharply from 50% to 18%.

Protection of farmers' interest in US deal surprised some: Govt's dig at OppositionPiyush Goyal dismissed criticism that the India-US trade deal would harm farmers and small producers, asserting that the interim framework fully safeguards their interests.

How India flipped the agri script on Trump? Piyush Goyal revealsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal stressed that India maintained its red lines on agriculture and dairy in its trade deal with the US, while opening its market selectively for certain items like wines and spirits.

What happens if the world's 10 richest people donate half their wealth?A trillion dollars from the world's richest may feel impossible, but pledges like Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal's prove that big commitments are possible. Imagine what happens if the top ten step forward.

India–US trade deal: Decoding impact of lower 18% tariffs and duty-free boostIndian goods that were slammed with nearly 50% US tariffs last year will now face only 18%, and some key sectors even go duty-free. Here's how the interim pact changes the outlook for exporters.

India to buy $500 billion of US goods in 5 years as new trade deal cuts tariffsIndia's USD 500 billion buying plan will anchor the interim trade framework, as New Delhi will cut tariffs on US goods and Washington will lower duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent under the proposed bilateral pact.

18% tariff, wider US market access: How India gains from trade pact with USIndia and the US have finally agreed on a framework for an interim trade agreement. In this article, we break down what it means and why it matters for India.

Tariffs to fall, markets to open, lakhs of jobs: Piyush Goyal on India-US dealThe agreement will see the US cut reciprocal tariffs on Indian goods to 18 per cent and eliminate duties on products such as generic pharmaceuticals, gems and diamonds, and aircraft parts, boosting export opportunities across key sectors.

India, US unveil interim trade pact; cut tariffs, open $30 trillion marketThe India-US trade deal marks a reset in trade ties, cutting Trump tariffs to 18 per cent and setting the stage for a sweeping bilateral deal amid geopolitical recalibrations.

US stocks hit historic milestone as Dow crosses 50,000 points for first timeUS stocks surged Friday as tech shares rebounded and bitcoin steadied, pushing the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq sharply higher despite lingering worries over heavy AI spending and market volatility.

How Google rode the AI wave to cross $400 billion in annual revenue for 1st timeGoogle said that the Gemini app alone has crossed 750 million monthly active users, showing that AI adoption is no longer limited to developers or businesses.

Fractal Analytics, Aye Finance IPOs to open next week: What investors should knowInvestors will have two fresh IPO opportunities next week as Fractal Analytics and Aye Finance open their public issues on February 9. The offerings span technology and finance, drawing attention from those looking to diversify their portfolios.

Bitcoin crash stuns markets. Decoding biggest crypto slump since Trump electionBitcoin has witnessed one of its sharpest corrections in recent years, wiping out more than $2 trillion from the global cryptocurrency market in a single day. The fall is the steepest since Donald Trump's election. It comes amid rising global risk aversion, weakness in technology and AI stocks, and sustained institutional selling pressure.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to close higher; IT stocks bleed to limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 266.47 points to close at 83,580.40, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 50.90 points to end at 25,693.70.

Why Ola, Uber and Rapido drivers are going on a 6-hour strike todayThe strike has been called by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union, also known as TGPWU. The union represents app-based transport workers operating on platforms such as Ola, Uber and Rapido.

Gold jumps Rs 1,000, silver falls Rs 6,000: Should you buy now or wait longer?Recent swings in gold and silver prices have caught investors' attention, with the metals showing mixed trends after a strong run. The big question now is whether this is a pause before the next move — should you buy now or wait longer?

Is Budget 2026 putting services at the centre of India's growth strategy?Budget 2026, in essence, quietly recognises that India's economic growth and job creation are and will continue to be powered by services – both tradable and non-tradable, while maintaining the focus on infrastructure and manufacturing.

Can RBI's new measures make it easier to do business and boost credit flow?With the RBI announcing new steps to improve credit access and ease regulations, attention is turning to their real-world impact. Could these changes help businesses grow and borrow more smoothly?

Why stock markets fell after RBI kept key lending rates unchanged Even though inflation is within the comfort band and growth remains robust, RBI signalled that it is not ready to shift toward a softer stance. Global uncertainties, from geopolitical tensions to commodity volatility, continue to influence the outlook.

entertainment.headline: Priyanka Chopra mourns Sunil Thapa, recalls how he helped after her father's loss Actor Priyanka Chopra paid tribute to her Mary Kom co-actor Sunil Thapa, who died in Kathmandu after a cardiac arrest. The actor shared a heartfelt message recalling Thapa's support during her difficult times, especially after she lost her father.

Amid breakup rumours, Tara Sutaria says she's learned to protect her peace Actor Tara Sutaria said she has learned to protect her peace and prioritise calm amid public scrutiny. Her remarks come as breakup rumours with Veer Pahariya swirl, with neither confirming or denying the reports.

Akshay Kumar's Bhooth Bangla gets a new release date. Details inside The makers of Bhooth Bangla, starring Akshay Kumar and Tabu, have officially announced that the film will release in cinemas a month earlier than originally announced. The announcement was shared by Balaji Motion Pictures along with a promotional video.

Aneet Padda, Ahaan Panday's Saiyaara re-released in theatres? Here's what we know Mohit Suri's romantic drama Saiyaara was the biggest romantic film of 2025. Have the makers re-released the film in theatres in 2026 just ahead of Valentine's Day? Here's everything you need to know.

Amaal Mallik snaps at fan wars, wants to cancel song video with Farrhana Bhatt Music composer Amaal Mallik voiced concern over negativity among fan clubs following his collaboration announcement with Bigg Boss 19 co-contestant Farrhana Bhatt. He said the backlash has left him disturbed and hesitant to release his new song video.

Rupali Ganguly shares loved-up pics to celebrate 13 years of marriage with Ashwin Rupali Ganguly celebrated 13 years of marriage with husband Ashwin K. Verma by sharing romantic Maldives photos and a heartfelt note on social media.

AP Dhillon to debut his new track on The Great Indian Kapil Show. Details inside Punjabi singer AP Dhillon will perform his song 'Thinking of You' for the first time on Netflix's The Great Indian Kapil Show. He will be joined by comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi for a lively episode blending music and comedy.

Priyanka Chopra posts anniversary wish for brother Siddharth and wife Neelam. Video Priyanka Chopra celebrated her brother Siddharth Chopra and Neelam Upadhyaya's first wedding anniversary with a heartfelt video and message on social media.

Sunil Thapa, who played Priyanka Chopra's on-screen coach in Mary Kom, dies at 68 Sunil Thapa, known for his roles in Nepali and Indian cinema, died in Kathmandu after a cardiac arrest. He was 68 years old and had worked with Priyanka Chopra in Mary Kom.

Finding Harmony review: Kate Winslet narrates King Charles's timeless harmony pleaRelease Date:Fri Feb 06, 2026 Finding Harmony: A King's Vision, directed by Nicolas Brown and narrated by Kate Winslet, traces King Charles III's enduring environmental philosophy through sustainable development projects. A visually stunning reminder that true progress lies in harmony with nature. Here's our review.

Kareena Kapoor revisits Saif Ali Khan's 'LOC: Kargil' moment: Little we did know Kareena Kapoor Khan shared a throwback clip of Saif Ali Khan from LOC: Kargil, writing "Little we did know" and leaving fans nostalgic.

Rang De Basanti celebrates 20 years, Aamir Khan joins cast for nostalgic reunion The cast of Rang De Basanti reunited in Mumbai for a special screening as the iconic film completed 20 years since its release.

Ayushmann Khurrana cheers Vadh 2: Hearing great things about the film Ayushmann Khurrana extended his best wishes to the team of Vadh 2 after hearing positive reviews about the film, which opened in theatres on February 6.

A year filled with all things you love: Neha Dhupia's birthday wish for Angad Bedi Neha Dhupia shared a heartfelt birthday post for husband Angad Bedi, offering fans a glimpse into his favourite things along with unseen moments from his life.

Exclusive: Korean stars Choi Soo-young, Kim Jae-young on fans, obsession and India In exclusive conversations with India Today, leads Choi Soo-young and Kim Jae-young reflect on why the show has resonated deeply with Indian audiences. Both actors credit India's emotional storytelling sensibility for truly "understanding" IDOL I, calling the response heartfelt, thoughtful and deeply moving.

Dhurandhar's Ayesha Khan calls Nora Fatehi, Tamannaah incredible amid comparisons Ayesha Khan has reacted to comparisons with Nora Fatehi and Tamannaah Bhatia, saying she respects their work and would never measure herself against them.

Halle Berry confirms engagement to musician Van Hunt after six years of dating Halle Berry has confirmed that she is engaged to musician Van Hunt, clearing the air around rumours that she had declined his proposal.

The trend of cutting disturbing teasers and the toxic, dhurandhar cinematic language Trailers and teasers in Indian cinema no longer just tease. From Dhurandhar to Toxic and Assi, filmmakers are choosing loud, often disturbing imagery to announce the worlds their films have arrived in.

16-hour shifts, severe burnout: Vikrant Massey on temporary hiatus from work Vikrant Massey has clarified that his 2024 announcement was not a retirement but a much-needed break caused by severe burnout and personal regrets about missing time with his family.

general news.headline: Reduced US tariffs of 18% on India come into effect. What it meansThe agreement will reduce US reciprocal duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent, while scrapping tariffs entirely on items such as generic medicines, gems and diamonds, and aircraft components—opening up stronger export prospects across several key sectors.

How India flipped the agri script on Trump? Piyush Goyal revealsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal stressed that India maintained its red lines on agriculture and dairy in its trade deal with the US, while opening its market selectively for certain items like wines and spirits.

India vs USA Live: Rinku departs, India in deep troubleIndia (IND) vs USA Live Cricket Score, T20 World Cup 2026: India have been rocked in the Powerplay. The defending champions have lost Abhishek Sharma (0), Ishan Kishan (20), Tilak Varma (25) and Shivam Dube (0) in the Powerplay after USA captain Monank Patel won the toss and opted to bowl in their campaign opener at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium on Saturday.

Father, son among 3 killed as speeding Audi rams their bike in Madhya PradeshThe deceased have been identified as Bhagwat Vishwakarma, a local resident, his younger son Rahul, and another family member who was accompanying them.

Trade deal: How Trump team left Pakistan red-faced with map of IndiaWhile releasing the trade deal details, the US trade representative's office released a map of India showing the entire Jammu and Kashmir, including Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK), as part of the country. Here's why it is important and marks a departure.
Cop dead, several hurt as swing collapses at Surajkund fair in FaridabadSeveral injured as swing breaks at Faridabad's Surajkund fair

India vs Pakistan match still on? Pak board, ICC in talks over boycott threatT20 World Cup 2026: The Pakistan Cricket Board has agreed to engage in further dialogue with the International Cricket Council after the global body questioned the Force Majeure clause invoked to justify boycotting the February 15 match against India in Colombo.

Did China conduct secret nuclear test days after Galwan clash with India?The Donald Trump administration has accused China of conducting a secret nuclear test on June 22, 2020. This is just seven days after Indian and Chinese forces clashed in Galwan amid the border standoff in eastern Ladakh.

Trump's Nobel fury: After India, it's PolandAfter India faced Donald Trump's wrath for refusing to endorse his demand for a Nobel Peace Prize, its now Poland's turn. Despite being one of the US' closest allies, the US cut off all ties with the Speaker of the country's Lower House of Parliament after he argued that the US President was not deserving of the Peace Prize.

Delhi biker's parents waited with anniversary cake, later saw his wrapped bodyKamal's parents waited all night for their wedding anniversary with a cake at their Delhi home. Hours later, they were handed their son's body.

Epstein Files is not a scandal, but a tale of cruelty and crimeWhile the world is salivating over the details in the Epstein Files, we must remember that it is a saga of sexual exploitation and violation of little girls. While the big names made headlines, little has been done to prosecute them and deliver justice to the survivors.

Asim Munir called Op Sindoor 'Ghazwa-e-Hind': Jaish commander's explosive claimA senior commander of Jaish-e-Mohammed has made a fresh admission linking Pakistan's military leadership and the terror outfits view of India's Operation Sindoor.

What is Omakase, the Japanese trend taking over Delhi barsAsk for a sour, vodka-based drink, and you might be handed a glass infused with amla murabba or even kimchi. Craving nostalgia? You could find yourself sipping on a cocktail that carries the unmistakable flavour of a Parle-G biscuit. This is the essence of what omakase bars are offering.

The rise of anti-ambition: Why young workers are opting out of the career raceGen Z professionals in India are redefining ambition by prioritising emotional stability and flexibility. This shift challenges traditional career paths and urges employers to rethink motivation strategies.

Ritu Tawde is BJP's Mumbai Mayor pick, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Ghadi is her DeputyThe race for Mumbai's top civic post has entered its decisive phase, with Mumbai BJP president Ameet Satam announcing Ritu Tawde as the party's nominee for Mayor of Mumbai.

Want to get laid: Indian tycoon's texts expose plan to spike woman's drinkWhat Indian-origin restaurateur Vikas Nath thought were private messages became public proof of intent, and the final link in a chain that led him from Mayfair's rooftop bar to a prison cell.

Amaal Mallik snaps at fan wars, wants to cancel song video with Farrhana BhattMusic composer Amaal Mallik voiced concern over negativity among fan clubs following his collaboration announcement with Bigg Boss 19 co-contestant Farrhana Bhatt. He said the backlash has left him disturbed and hesitant to release his new song video.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Bangladesh Hindu leader dies; questions raised on custody deathFive-time Bangladesh MP and former minister Ramesh Chandra Sen died on Saturday after falling ill in custody. Bangladeshis are claiming a pattern as the death of Sen, a veteran Hindu leader, was similar to other Awami League politicians'. Sen was a mass leader and known for his helpful nature and untainted political career.

Mental health flux: Wuthering Heights on Valentine's, Frankenstein on Father's Day?Handcrafted ByOur Editors Valentine's Day keeps selling emotional intensity as romance. So when Wuthering Heights is packaged as love, it exposes a mental-health blind spot about what we normalise. Read this to see how cultural myths about love quietly shape anxiety and unhealthy attachment.

The trend of cutting disturbing teasers and the toxic, dhurandhar cinematic languageTrailers and teasers in Indian cinema no longer just tease. From Dhurandhar to Toxic and Assi, filmmakers are choosing loud, often disturbing imagery to announce the worlds their films have arrived in.

Latecomer Gujarat student slaps teacher, says who are you to question me; arrestedA Class 12 student allegedly slapped a female teacher after she questioned him for arriving late to a preliminary exam in Gujarat's Panchmahal district.

Man leaves bodies of wife, son in mortuary to attend SIR hearing in BengalMohammad Yasin Ansari, who is a teacher by profession, was headed to a bus stand along with his wife, Halima Khatun, and their nine-month-old son to eventually reach the hearing centre, his brother-in-law, Abdur Rahman Ansari, said.

Biography of street fighter: Mamata and making of permanent political scrapperOn February 4, Mamata Banerjee created a bit of history. She became both the petitioner and pleader in the Supreme Court, causing eyebrows to be raised. But we shouldn't have been surprised. Showing up for the good fight is Mamata's credo, her political signature. She just can't outsource the good fight. She is not a politician who occasionally fights. She's a fighter who occasionally governs.

sports.headline: IND vs USA: Sanju Samson dropped, Jasprit Bumrah rested due to illness T20 World Cup 2026: India dropped Sanju Samson from the XI to accommodate in-form Ishan Kishan for their opening match against the USA in Mumbai on Saturday. Mohammed Siraj, who replaced injured Harshit Rana, got a game straightaway after Jasprit Bumrah missed out due to illness.

T20 World Cup: Shepherd hat-trick, Hetmyer blitz power West Indies past Scotland ICC T20 World Cup: Romario Shepherd's hat-trick and Shimron Hetmyer's fighting fifty helped West Indies begin their campaign with a 35-run win over Scotland at Kolkata's Eden Gardens on Saturday.

T20 World Cup: England name playing XI for opening game vs Nepal, drop Ben Duckett England have announced their playing XI for the opening game of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, making a key change by dropping Ben Duckett. Captain Harry Brook faces scrutiny after a disciplinary incident, but the team remains confident ahead of the tournament.

India vs Pakistan match still on? Pak board, ICC in talks over boycott threat T20 World Cup 2026: The Pakistan Cricket Board has agreed to engage in further dialogue with the International Cricket Council after the global body questioned the Force Majeure clause invoked to justify boycotting the February 15 match against India in Colombo.

Rahmanullah Gurbaz pulls out of PSL days after joining Peshawar Zalmi Afghanistan wicketkeeper-batter Rahmanullah Gurbaz has opted out of the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2026, after fellow Afghanistan international Naveen-ul-Haq earlier posted a cryptic message on Facebook.

New Zealand couldn't have had better T20 World Cup preps than playing India: Mitchell Santner T20 World Cup 2026, NZ vs AFG: Speaking to the reporters before the clash against Afghanistan on Sunday, Mitchell Santner said that New Zealand couldn't have hoped for better preparations than playing a series against India. Before the mega event, the Kiwis played a bilateral series where India beat them 4-1.

India vs USA Live: Suryakumar fights amid flurry of wickets India (IND) vs USA Live Cricket Score, T20 World Cup 2026: India have been rocked in the Powerplay. The defending champions have lost Abhishek Sharma (0), Ishan Kishan (20), Tilak Varma (25) and Shivam Dube (0) in the Powerplay after USA captain Monank Patel won the toss and opted to bowl in their campaign opener at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium on Saturday.

Has Afghanistan moved past underdog tag? Rashid Khan opens up before New Zealand clash T20 World Cup 2026, NZ vs AFG: Speaking to the reporters, Rashid Khan opened up on whether Afghanistan have moved past the tag of underdogs. Rashid will have his task cut out when the Afghans start their campaign against New Zealand on Sunday in Chennai.

Faheem Ashraf's prayer answered: Pakistan star recalls Dutch wild ride in Colombo Pakistan all-rounder Faheem Ashraf admitted he was holding his breath — every part of his body silently praying for a catch to go down—during the penultimate over of a tense but ultimately successful run chase against the Netherlands in their T20 World Cup opener on Saturday.

India stars Varun and Kuldeep visit Siddhivinayak temple on matchday morning T20 World Cup 2026: Indian cricketers Varun Chakravarthy and Kuldeep Yadav sought the blessings of the Almighty at Mumbai's famed Siddhivinayak Temple on the morning of their opening match against the USA.

Should Afghanistan back women's cricket? Rashid Khan breaks his silence T20 World Cup, NZ vs AFG: Rashid Khan has spoken out on whether Afghanistan should encourage women's cricket in the country. With 700 T20 wickets within reach, the star leg-spinner is set to feature in Afghanistan's opening match of the men's tournament on Sunday in Chennai.

T20 World Cup: Chennai's Chidambaram Stadium gets a new look with upgraded outfieldTNCA has completed extensive upgrades to the outfield and drainage system at the MA Chidambaram Stadium, aimed at improving playing conditions and strengthening cricket development across Tamil Nadu.

Pakistan do a Pakistan, flirt with disaster against Netherlands on opening dayT20 World Cup 2026: Babar Azam's fielding magic teased a new professional era, but a classic middle-order collapse forced Pakistan to scramble for a heart-stopping, narrow victory over the Netherlands in their opening match in Colombo on Saturday.

Manchester United to buy RCB? Glazer brothers bid for IPL team: ReportPremier League giants Manchester United could be headed for a major IPL crossover, with co-owner Avram Glazer reportedly placing a massive bid for Royal Challengers Bengaluru. If it goes through, the deal could be one of the biggest in sporting history.

WI vs SCO highlights: Hat-trick hero Romario Shepherd leads West Indies' winWest Indies (WI) vs Scotland (SCO) highlights, T20 World Cup 2026: West Indies have taken an emphatic win with Romario Shepherd having a game for the ages as his hat-trick and five-wicket haul led to the two-time champions getting the win by 35 runs.

USA have done their T20 World Cup homework on favourites India: Saurabh NetravalkarUSA may be the underdogs, but Saurabh Netravalkar insists they are not walking in blind against India. The pacer said the Americans have studied the favourites closely and are ready for the challenge in their T20 World Cup opener.

Catch of the T20 World Cup? Babar Azam ensures Pakistan dodge the memesPakistan shrugged off opening-day jitters with a rare fielding masterclass. Babar Azam's stunning relay catch set the tone in their T20 World Cup 2026 opener against the Netherlands in Colombo.

BCCI announces Rs 7.5 crore reward for India's U19 World Cup championsIndia's Under-19 World Cup celebrations got bigger as the BCCI announced a Rs 7.5 crore reward for the new champions. The cash prize comes after Ayush Mhatre's unbeaten side crushed England by 100 runs in Harare.

Pakistan to rethink India boycott stance? PCB to consult govt over Sri Lanka pleaT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan Cricket Board will consult the government again after Sri Lanka Cricket warned of financial and reputational losses if the marquee clash against India is boycotted. The Pakistan government said the senior national men's team will not play India in Colombo on February 15.

Bumrah doubtful for India's T20 World Cup opener vs USA: ReportsJasprit Bumrah is reportedly doubtful for India's T20 World Cup 2026 opener against USA after missing training with a mild fever. With tougher Group A games ahead, India may rest him as a precaution.

Sooryavanshi leads India's U19 World Cup celebrations, grooves to Bhojpuri beatsVaibhav Sooryavanshi capped India's sixth U19 World Cup triumph with a historic final, smashing a breathtaking 175 and then leading the celebrations with equal flair in the dressing room.

Let the game begin: Can a 20-team T20 World Cup heal a fractured sport?Handcrafted ByOur Editors From the simple magic of ink-stained schedules to the heavy drama of modern boycotts, cricket's soul is at a crossroads. As twenty nations take the field today, can the purity of the pitch finally silence the noise of the boardroom?

Sunil Gavaskar shreds Pak over T20 boycott: It's always us reaching outSunil Gavaskar has called out Pakistan's repeated expectation of India making the first move in cricketing ties. The Indian legend said invitations and gestures have rarely been reciprocated, especially amid the latest India–Pakistan World Cup boycott row.

PAK vs NED Highlights: Pakistan survive major scare in opening-day thrillerPakistan (PAK) vs Netherlands (NED) Live Score, T20 World Cup 2026: What a thriller in Colombo! Pakistan were cruising towards the 148-run target, before deciding to implode. It looked improbable in the last two overs, but a Faheem Ashraf special helps them cross the finish line. Crucial two points for Pakistan as they begin their campaign well. Kudos to the Netherlands for fighting hard.

India-Pakistan issues not our concern: USA's Saurabh Netravalkar stays clear of debateUSA pacer Saurabh Netravalkar says India–Pakistan tensions have never entered the American dressing room. As the T20 World Cup begins, he insists USA remain focused only on cricket, not politics.

After U19 World Cup triumph, Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's father hopeful of India call-upVaibhav Sooryavanshi's Under-19 World Cup heroics have sparked fresh calls for a senior India future. After his record-breaking final knock, his father believes the teenage star's India cap is only a matter of time.

IND vs USA: India begin bid for history in Green Card vs Aadhaar Card clashT20 World Cup 2026, India vs USA: Defending champions India will kick off their ICC Men's T20 World Cup campaign against a multicultural USA side at Mumbai's iconic Wankhede Stadium. With eight members of the USA squad tracing their roots back to India, Saturday's clash has been colloquially billed as Green Card versus Aadhaar Card.

Matchday Preview: Forgotten heroes West Indies begin campaign with India, PakistanT20 World Cup 2026: Matchday preview: The opening day of the T20 World Cup 2026 will feature three fixtures, namely Pakistan vs Netherlands, West Indies vs Scotland and India vs USA. Here's our match-wise guide for the opening day of the tournament

Somewhere between rift and rain, T20 World Cup begins for PakistanThe ICC T20 World Cup begins with Pakistan taking on Netherlands in the curtain-raiser. Between rift with ICC and tricky conditions, do Pakistan have it in them to focus on the match?

No team wins T20 World Cup without beating India: WI head coach Darren SammyT20 World Cup 2026: West Indies coach Daren Sammy reflected on past glories and urged his team to create history as they prepare for the T20 World Cup, underlining the formidable obstacle posed by India.

T20 World Cup to defend, home crowd to please and Suryakumar Yadav just smiling awayT20 World Cup 2026: Suryakumar Yadav leads India under immense World Cup pressure with a constant smile. Calm in chaos, he trusts preparation and people, carrying expectation lightly as Indian captaincy demands everything.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
